cjeLG-UfldKyXplS_BQuvQ.text: Their coconut chicken salad was absolutely delicious. The flavors of the chicken, grilled pineapple and cranberries worked really well together.  I was pleasantly surprised how tasty it was. Best salad I've had in a while. I also like the variety of salad dressings. Service was a bit slow but still good. If you are looking for a non-chain place, this is your place . I like the menu. I'm tempted by the deserts but haven't had any yet.

lkDtsPLW5De0rLCUfCXGgQ.text: 3.5 stars for the food and 3 for service.  This diner was recommended by a coworker so we went for dinner one rainy evening.  We were seated right away and our food arrived quickly. We noticed there seemed to be a few regulars eating at nearby tables.  Our waitress came by our table once to ask us if everything was okay but spent the rest of the time catering to the regulars and we felt neglected.  Needless to say the food was adequate and filling and the service sub-par. Cute country decor where pro golfer's signed plates adorn the wall.

c0ldP879hNKKFZQa3Hjb4g.text: This food is absurdly good. Poached eggs and hollandaise are what I've eaten at pricey East End brunch spots. Scrambled eggs are soft and fluffy, not overcooked. Tasty, well seasoned everything. Coconut chicken salad is exceptional; lightly breaded, real coconut, juicy and seared to perfection. Mixed greens in all salads. Housemade dressings to die for. Wedding soup - absolutely top of the heap in the whole region.   Great, now I'm starving.

8eJ6OuyBiGo2chuvunHZqA.text: My friend and I went here for brunch on a Sunday.   It took a long time to get seated, when there were tables available. They do have coffee for the wait however, which is nice. This seems to be a popular place with the sunday mass crowd.   We ordered both of the specials.  The first was a crab and veggie omlet, which was decent, but nothing to write home about.  The second was a french toast covered with cherry preserves. These were pretty much pie filling cherries, and the french toast was fairly generic bread. Thus, the flavors on a whole were overpowered by the canned pie filling. If I wanted that, I would make a mountain pie.

YvnR1PBErLUjLT5WOgcQbw.text: Down home and delicious!   My dad loves the Italian omelet, so this is a frequent breakfast spot for my family.   It's a great, affordable dinner spot. Great Italian.

z2XBM6ubNNlHoFupDx7HAw.text: Subpar food. Maybe it was the day but both myself and partner felt our food tasted old and fatty. Nice service but wouldn't go back.

a_40sKnaSm7ZI_mt4T9DJA.text: This place is BYOB. Bring a bottle of wine to have with dinner. NO CORK FEE! There's a wine and spirits just a few feet away. The service isn't all that wonderful, but some of the servers mean well. However the wait for the food is usually worth it in the end. Nice change of pace with it not being a chain.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Gumbo

JmPkfLrN6td8TSYZSQ-p1w.text: Although I am rarely in Oakmont, my best friend lives there and has taken me to Casey's a few times while I am visiting.  We went for dinner on Saturday night and I had an amazing salad - Casey's Famous Caesar Salad.  The addition of tortellini was really great and the grilled chicken was perfectly seasoned.  This was a large salad that I could not even finish and came to under $13.  The only complaint that I have is that service was a little slow initially, but it did seem like they were slammed with customers because their food is so good!

5o1sJ9Zr5ONiKzk-XMDzFg.text: Have had breakfast and dinner at Casey's and enjoyed both meals. This restaurant is kind of a throw back in time because the owner actually cares both about its patrons and the food. You will feel at home eating here enjoying good quality food and service. Forget the chains, eat at Casey's, the price is right and you are treated like you are a friend. Comfort food but with specials and  don't forget to bring a bottle of wine , there is no corkage. Nicely decorated, comfortable surroundings and good food plus BYOB with no corkage. My kind of restaurant and open 7 days a week!. Lots on the menu to try for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

kCXTAKWS_4GoPCrdgjOgbg.text: Great little Italian eatery. Highly recommend the stuffed hot peppers and the wedding soup. The pizza looked very good too! BYOB, NO COORKAGE FEE ( : Did I mention the prices are reasonable? Give it a try. Gret find

Cai9WNrpbwQ1ngXydh2H5A.text: Comforable restaurant with a large menu and dependably good food. I don't think I've had anything I haven't liked except the creamsicle cake, but HEY, how often do you find that on a menu??  If you miss your grandma, come to Casey's.........there's always enough that I feel like I'm the youngest person in there.  Reliable with good food and a friendly wait staff. You will have to wait for a table during peak eating times.

yoNpD8YM_9_czr_6Pxxjjw.text: Decent food, but not the best service (slow). 40+min ticket time and louder than average noise levels. Nice little place though, if you're not in a rush and don't mind a little dust.

rJMwtcz2HMAlsDHqst8KOA.text: Always good food at Casey's! My favorite place for breakfast, usually a wait but well worth it. Staff is great and food is consistently pleasant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner! The homemade Pizza crust is awesome!

nK9b3trS2Q6J11U7823BcA.text: This place just no. It is completely below average food and the ambiance leaves a lot to desire. Yea basically just do not go is what I recommend.

i-xG5pnKX4SucnhfnH3ChQ.text: I can only speak for the breakfast... but, boy oh boy, was it good?! Traditional style breakfast offerings, cooked to perfection, good serving sizes - all at a completely reasonable price. Can't go wrong with Casey's for breakfast!!

UcBgmrCbarJWxZJOuCWJeA.text: The last time we were there we called ahead and still had to wait 45 minutes for a table. we were seated and had a party of 6 (2 kids and 4 adults) and we sat for another 25 minutes and no one ever waited on us besides menus when they seated us and even the host was getting drinks for tables he sat after us but not us. We after another 5 minutes got up and left... I may be trying them again tomorrow and I will update then!!

ba6YKvWNYiMWu5cuLdDFtA.text: Standard breakfast/brunch/lunch type food. Cheap pricing. Gets very busy at breakfast on the weekends. Not a very big place to begin with

VyCB27WzXIDACzAgPYMVIA.text: I've only gotten takeout from Casey's. I ordered Fettuccini Alfredo and Spinach & Artichoke Dip. The staff was very rude when I picked up my food. When I got it home, they didn't include the bread with the dip. So now I have dip and nothing to eat it with.. Food was very average. Won't be ordering from there again.

9OOUfvyn291rrqPSB6EhqQ.text: While visiting my aunt, we decided to go to What's Cookin' at Casey's. Small quaint place. Nothing fancy but food is reasonably priced and the place is very clean. Street parking is your only option.  BYOB and no cork charge.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States

zBL3E3LVV66xX1x-U04Sog.text: Food is decent here, but service can be slow at times. Once waited 15 mins for a glass of ice water that I asked the waitress and busboy for and never got it till the waitress came back with the check. But it is a decent place for such a small town.

T5wEO-Vezkio8KcmkhsPyw.text: Big menu, big portions, great price. Wait staff is always friendly and fast. Meals are just like homecooked. Plus you can walk the boulevard before or after. This is our go-to family place for lunch or dinner - a fantastic neighborhood spot. We love Casey's!

qZW1OQikhwiJcLhHCjhOcA.text: I've had many very good experiences here over the years but today's not so much...waitress is miserable and all of the lights are constantly flickering like we are in a haunted house...we won't be back for a while...

xHWWoh_aAtPYA5TiC3nD3w.text: Wow,, what a great hometown restaurant, I believe if you cannot say nothing good, do not write a review, just move onto the next place, this place is awesome the staff is amazing, they also let you bring your own bottle, they treat you like royalty, the chef is impeccable, he always outdoes himself, the owners are great they take pride in the restaurant and she treats it like her own child, the staff are Very friendly very attentive you cannot be the food the taste the service, I recommend this place to everyone.

LUZ7R2hhWzaktRAL8jWy6A.text: We were starving so the place was good enough. It is quaint and cute. The woman who seems to run the place was not welcoming at all and would be the #1 reason for me not to ever return. The employees seemed stressed, some more welcoming than others. The bacon is paper thin. The potatoes were good. The prices are decent. Overall, I would never recommend this place but would go back if there was nothing better around.

EAbPoUOCT7PXb9j4bWyAog.text: The waitress was nice   But the food took TO LONG ( 30 minutes) Just pancakes and an omelette  The place was empty   Food average

pVpE0THB-Qz8VIH3y2T8wQ.text: What's cooking at Casey's? Nothing overly delectable at this Oakmont fixture, but it's filling + moderately priced. The standard breakfast fare needs a bit more flavor, especially the home fries. And the pancakes were a little too dense for my liking. The dinner menu favors Italian w/ the calzone easily taking the 'best value' title. Overall, their food has been hit or miss over the years as has their service. However, it's still a decent option to "eat local."

De9yn16qj268VpnzxtoxtA.text: Casey's is a great little place to have omelets and classic breakfast food. The portions are huge.  The eggs benedict is pretty good too. The services is good and parking is easy. You can take a walk in the adorable town of Oamont to work off the calories after!

xKKcEy0at6OeQ1NCfTggXA.text: Joanie was our server and she was very attentive. We got the Italian omelette and a side of fresh fruit. This place definitely does breakfast the right way. Fresh ingredients and hot off the grill. On a side note, we were able to observe one of the prep cooks in the kitchen. She spent the entire time peeling, chopping, and preparing carrots in the back. Everything is fresh here. Very impressive.

9UC5QI707SDPMMa2yychxw.text: Despite friends loving this place, have tried it now 3 occasions...2x for breakfast and 1x for dinner.    The food was ok, not great.  The 2x times for breakfast - the first time the breakfast was not real good (service was good).  The second time was a "walk out".  Appreciate getting coffee while waiting but once we were seated, no one came for our table (I actually do not think any servers were assigned to our table).  After 10 minutes, we got up and left.  The dinner experience was similar experience...ok but there are other places/options in my opinion that are better.    I can't and won't give it 2 star or less - better than that but service was not good twice and ok once and food was "ok" at best.  If I could give it 2.5 stars, I would.   Not the best by far and not the worst by far.

Bf8GGuZt4lacl5uMx1JvbA.text: Great food great service their mushroom soup is fantastic!!! Great horseradish dip!!!

VwJUtsn6wKsOdP1CirY_kA.text: Nice little place on Allegheny River Boulevard in Oakmont. The food is decent but nothing special. They server average American dishes.

hkBKlwGLbs6WMDVSs8hcIA.text: For not being much of a breakfast person, this place got me to change my mind. Everything taste home-made, delicious. Their lunch and dinner is good as well but the breakfast is by far the best. Staff seems a little unorganized other wise they are friendly. Looking for a good sunday morning spot. Go to Casey's!

5f7bqTFGeb8XqXeQpnf5Rw.text: Ate there this morning. Bacon was burnt, they forgot to add mushrooms to a 'mushrooms and cheese' omelette, and to top it off I ordered a takeout bowl of soup and honest to God the waitress sneezed into her hand holding the styrofoam soup container and then said 'I'll go get your soup'. This is not my first bad experience here, but it sure is going to be my last. This place should have a lot higher standards if it's going to keep operating in Oakmont.

LsKfsUXWSvo_Qk6bAWieng.text: I like this pla e a lot. The food is honestly average but the people that work their and own this restaurant are really nice and pleasant, it makes for a nice experience.

lbwiLf4lgPHZxgi2ob57oQ.text: Such a cute eatery! We were greeted with the nicest people who seated us right away. There is just the right amount of choices on the menu to accommodate even the pickiest eater. I got the Greek omelette with egg whites, potatoes, and multigrain bread. The potatoes are golden and crispy, so they taste more like French fries than breakfast potatoes. The toast came pre-buttered and the omelette was super yummy. We also split the full stack of blueberry pancakes.  The pancake itself was okay, but the blueberry compote on top tasted delicious! It's safe to say we were all completely stuffed after this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Greek Omelette with eggs whites, potatoes, and multigrain bread

zixEYSgCrQQUHTvZzkJrIg.text: A nice spot in Oakmont. The restaurant space is cozy, it's a bit of throwback once you get inside. They are a BYOB (no corkage fee), there's a Wine and Spirits located conveniently a few doors down. They weren't too busy for a Friday night and they seemed to have plenty of staff but the service wasn't great, kind of slow. I had a Club Sandwich which was fine, nothing too exciting about it. The fries were good. I tried the wedding soup too which was pretty good as well. They had a decent dessert selection. The prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Club Sandwich

EptzxruxM3IEkxhhR1699g.text: I love Oakmont! I visited this quaint little town for the first time and it felt like I took a step back in time. This restaurant is located right on the main drag and there is plenty of on street parking.   As soon as we walked in the employees were so nice and attentive. We were seated immediately, and I really enjoyed the "at home" feel of this place.   For lunch my friend had the wedding soup (which I recommended with the help of yelp) and the Cuban sandwich, which he said was very good.   My sandwich came out and I was not happy with it. The bread was soaked in butter and quite soggy. Also, my "veggie" sandwich was really lacking some vegetables. I told my waiter and he did bring more out.. and the manager/owner also apologized but that was about it.   The French fries were very basic, I regret not ordering the sweet potato fries.   I'm torn between giving 3-4 stars, I choose 4 because this place seems like a very established local spot and I think with a little more attention to detail they could easily be 4-5 star.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Veggie sandwich with not enough veggies though - also very basic unseasoned fries
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Cuban sandwich
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Dining area, kitchen seemed very clean

cENA5zj2xAgdDxZJohx_oA.text: Wonderful staff, great hometown restaurant feel. My husband and I received a coupon for a free breakfast when we moved to the neighborhood. We were so happy with the quality and prices of the food along with the staff and decor.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Capicola omelette.
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Breakfast combo.

v5G3P5qpYYU37FkY3RzoQQ.text: I had breakfast yesterday food and service great. Highly recommend the Omelettes. All r great

azp422V8YhZmERfiGdWLtQ.text: The review below is from months ago. Nothing has changed except the following: ordered the Italian toast for a $.30 upcharge and ended up paying more for the same pre-toasted then warmed up (and dry) result. Waitress seemed very tired and not too interested. Scrambled eggs were hard, swimming in the grease from the sausage, and not really scrambled in the culinary sense. Since it has been months and nothing has improved this will be our last sojourn to this place for breakfast.   Review from summer 2018: "I have been going to this place for a couple decades at least and have always given them highest recommendation on yelp and to friends. Even now that we live 20mi away we will still drive down occasionally usually for a special date breakfast. Today we were surprised to find that the menu has changed and a couple of our traditional favorites no longer exist or have changed. These are some of the changes we noticed today. No frittatasone our family favorites and something that most places don't make very well if at all. Omelette is not quite as big nor tender. We no longer are asked for a choice of toast. The toast I got as a default was bagged bread that had a weird flavor as if it were pre toasted then reheated on the grill which gave it an odd flavor. Maybe picking up something off the grill? Unless you are a fan of barbecue chips you may want to skip the home fried potatoes. In the past these were always very lightly seasoned with a touch of seasoning salt. Now they taste like bar fries. The seasoning completely blows out the egg dish on your plate. My wife said the eggs Benedict were still good however she didn't eat the potatoes after trying mine. My suspicion is that no one is verifying the flavors that come out of the kitchen. The server is the last line of defense in a place like this and our server completely missed that everything was not on the plate. IMHO this place is not much different now than what we have in our neighborhood and not worth the drive.  We may try it again in a few weeks to see if they get their stuff together. After that, at least for breakfast, we will probably pass.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. 6 pieces of Mancini Raisin bread
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Frittata and Raisin French toast. Large portions!

BF-Chc3qWDIJwI5kuU6-Qw.text: This was always my favorite place when visiting home. The waitress was horrible. She forgot to put in one of our orders so we had to wait longer. There was only 2 other tables in the restaurant to begin with. Also they changed my favorite dish. Put the orange sauce back in the Turkey devonshire.

OhOmJ81C_9QcBRjCWyCOqg.text: Handsdown the best place I have ever found In Oakmont . . . Amazing food and over the top customer service. All thumbs up. I will be beck.

sMBmMRykry4j4QPP5qAdqg.text: I love this place. The employees are awesome and the food is to die for! It was my moms birthday and they made her day!!!

bWsYu7DnDNEKg0-J0P6Knw.text: Not what it used to be. Stopped for lunch with my husband as he has never been here and I always would tell him how good everything was. It was a little busy, but we were seated right away at a little table right outside the kitchen. Seating is very cramped and all of the tables are really close together. It took quite a bit for a waitress to finally come over, and when she did you could tell that she did not want to be there. I ordered a chicken salad sandwich in a croissant and my husband ordered the Rueben lunch special. The food came out and I was disappointed to see that nothing else was served with the croissant. No fries or chips or anything. My husband's meal.. oh man. Hardly any meat on his Rueben, and wait for it..... six French fries. SIX! It looked like a kids meal. We honestly thought it was a joke. It sure looked like one. We got out of there and had to stop for more food somewhere else on the way home because we were both still starving.   *I heard that Casey's was under new ownership since the last time I'd been there, so maybe that's why so much changed. I used to love it there but I can honestly say that we will never be going back.

DWR0juHyavsgMg4-qYO7nw.text: Horrible. We have been going here since 2011, but have noticed in the last year the menu has changed each time we have come. Tonight has ended this era. Absolutely terrible from the start. Two pieces of stale bread, soggy croutons in the salad, completely cold pasta, my $18 chicken Marsala was 3 chicken tenderloins with a few (and I mean a few) canned mushrooms and some thin gravy with the slightest hint of Marsala taste. I noticed all new faces working (and I should mention there were more waitstaff than patrons this time, at 6:30pm on a Saturday night). I'm not sure what went wrong here, but it's very sad to see what used be such a great place turn to absolute robbery. Save your money or go to Bob Evans 3x over for the same quality food.

qsiwuNzH592v4UXvw7xRyQ.text: My wife and I heard good things about their breakfast and how busy they get, so we stopped in on a late Sunday morning around 11 am. We expected to have a little bit of a wait, but were seated immediately. They have your standard breakfast fare, but it isn't quite a "local diner," as it has more of a Bob Evans-type feel.   The positives: I ordered the country omelet, which was filled with mushrooms, peppers, onions, cheese, and ham. It wasn't greasy at all and was pretty good. So was the Mancini toast.  The negatives: The plate of fruit my wife ordered was a major disappointment for her, because it was basically canned mixed fruit with some bananas and strawberries thrown on top. You could taste the acidic juice it was swimming in. We had hoped a local, family-owned place would have fresh fruit. The raisin toast also tasted stale and didn't have any sweetness.   Lastly, the coffee was pretty bad - which is hard to do.  I still give it 4 stars because the eggs were good, which is the main staple of any breakfast anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Country Omelet
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Poached eggs and raisin toast

T6qSPtcF4uzHHYzCDjFTLg.text: Casey's.   This is a local hot spot. Oakmonters love Casey's! It's definitely got a very southern/homey feel to it. I like coming here for breakfast with friends on a weekend or something. I like to come when I have a lot of time because it not only looks like you are in the South but feels like it. It's slow. Everything is slow. But when you're catching up with friends over breakfast...slow is kind of tolerable. Kind of. However, if I'm in a rush or just want a faster eating experience, Casey's ain't the place, ya'll (see what I did there?).   You know how they say if it looks like a duck, walks like a duck, and quacks like a duck then it's probably a duck? Yeah. Casey's is really like a diner. Maybe that's very well known? I don't think they claim to be a diner but it tastes like a diner. So, I feel it is a bit overpriced for the quality of food.   Breakfast is tastey. It's a diner kind of breakfast - just more expensive.   Have time to kill? Want to step into coziness? Casey's. Try it.

photos.caption: Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Dining area.
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Dining area.
Photo of What's Cooking at Casey's - Oakmont, PA, United States. Old semi-haunted pictures are all over this restaurant.

emdAkMIWaKG9tQezwPGIWQ.text: I always come here when I'm in the area for the Italian wedding soup. I've never had better. It's homemade with tons of little meatballs, shredded chicken, spinach, carrots, onions and pasta. Very hardy soup. The place is very homey. The food is all Home cooking. This was the first trip for my entire family and they loved it too. My son had the kids cheeseburger and fries. It was very flavorful unlike most kids burgers. My husband had open face roast beef sandwich with mashed potatoes. And I had the lunch special, half a tuna sandwich and fries. I added a cup of the wedding soup. Also took Home a quart of the wedding soup too. Our bill came to $40. The wait time for the food is a little long when they are full and it's hard to move around in the restaurant. They have more tables than they should. Never disappoints though!

AXDb8885vSo2oIencmUmJg.text: Food is ok... service is great if you don't  mind  waiting  a long time.  Staff is full of attitide.. go if you have a  lots of time

7ZKIjwuD0rmLy8zC2OO8xA.text: This was the worst meal I've ever eaten from this restaurant. I just moved back to Oakmont and the prices of the food have increased, but the quality of the food has drastically decreased. I ordered through UberEats. 90% of my meals ordered through this service are always on par: the food is correct, the food is delicious, the food presentation and temperature are good and the Uber drivers are professional. Each of these categories received 1?star. If I could give no star that would have been my preference. It started with the unprofessionally dressed Uber driver accompanied with an attitude to match. Next upon taking the food out of the bag, I was splattered with pasta sauce due to the fact that the lid wasn't closed on the container. Half of the food was spilled out in the bag. Next was good ole Jerry's Meatballs, advertised 2 for $2.00. The only provided one. Next was the side salad that came with the meal, but the house dressing was missing which was 1.00. Yes, every salad that came with a meal cost a $1.00. Talk about severe uncharging. They also forgot the bread and butter , plus the meal was cold. Moreover , the second meal was supposed to be a medium-well done extra blue cheese bacon burger with crispy fries and pickles on the side. The burger was charred, there was enough blue cheese to cover 1/4 of the burger , the fries were limp and no pickles . Granted I didn't have to pay a delivery fee, but my total was 38.65 pre-tip. I should have went to Burgatory or Michael A's. If a restaurant is going to charge high prices and up charge for food , back it up with quality food , quality delivery prep employees before the food goes out the door . I suggest upgrading your menu and the quality of your food . I reviewed the Uber driver on their app. Please note, I will never eat in your establishment and I will never recommend your restaurant . Thank you .

OBB8SrYlbeN7zAeZOk6EHA.text: They serve pasta with sliced white bread.  You know, like Wonderbread, except not as upscale. Skip this place and treat yourself to a meal at 7-Eleven, which has better food, service, and atmosphere.

tFJoFWWJ0vfSuH5N--eL0A.text: I've been to Casey's a few different times. The food is always good! The menu is long but not the kind of long that is completely overwhelming, so that's wonderful!  The atmosphere at Casey's is likely what keeps people coming back. It's like walking into your gammy's living room and dining room. Except that you have to pay for your food, and no one is asking you who you're dating and why you're not married yet.  If you're from the area, no doubt you'll run into someone you know. You'll have to decide for yourself if that is good or bad - love your neighbors? It's good! On the lamb? It's probably bad!   The one thing that Casey's is known for (at least from my experience or the people I know) that is not that great is the wait time. When you go to Casey's set aside a decent amount of time, because you will be there for a while. I'm not sure why causes the length... Possibly that there isn't enough room to hire other servers? They certainly have fit in as many tables and booths into the room as could legally be fit.

rMzG52IWA5Yn_pd5wgyNDw.text: My husband is the from the Verona area so anytime we are close by and could have breakfast or lunch we are sure to stop at Casey's in Oakmont!  My first time there I had the chicken salad on a croissant and about 7 years later I haven't really ordered anything else! It's so good that I can't help but order it every time! I usually add a wedding soup to complete my meal and it's perfect!   The place feels so real. Meaning the older couple across from us was seated and the waitress already knew their order.  People are greeted by name and the staff is friendly to first timers. The decor is like Cracker Barrel but real, not manufactured by a chain. I always feel at home, almost as if I'm sitting in my grandmas dining room.   Sometimes there's a long wait and the bathroom is way too small but it's worth it.
